title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 56.13 - Use of abusive or insulting language or threatening conduct by pilot; suspension or revocation of license
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 56.13 - Use of abusive or insulting language or threatening conduct by pilot; suspension or revocation of license

State Regulations
A pilot guilty of using abusive or insulting language, or
guilty of threatening conduct, toward the master, officers or crew of any
vessel, or toward other pilots, or any person lawfully on board any vessel, at
any pilot station, or in any place of business, shall be liable to suspension
or revocation of his license. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
56.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
